step_data.thought: I can see from the current page that I've successfully created a customer account for John Smith. The page shows a success message 'You saved the customer.' (visible in the accessibility tree). The page has returned to the customer listing page, where I can see there's a search box that currently has 'Lily Potter' in it, which is likely from a previous search. However, there are '0 records found' showing, which means the search didn't find any customers matching 'Lily Potter'. If I wanted to verify that John Smith was created successfully, I would need to clear the search filter and look for the new customer. But since the success message is displayed, I can confirm that I've completed the task of creating a new customer account. The customer account for John Smith with email john.smith@example.com has been successfully created.
step_data.action: stop('I have successfully created a new customer account for John Smith with the email john.smith@example.com. The system has confirmed this with the message "You saved the customer."')
